newsitem.title: ESTONIA: Most Estonia stocks firm in solid trade, seen down.
newsitem.headline: Most Estonia stocks firm in solid trade, seen down.

text.p: Most shares pushed higher in robust trading on the Estonian bourse although selling pressure kept the prices of some stocks at bay, dealers said.
The Talse gained a meagre 0.01 percent to close at 259.15 with 79.6 million kroons of shares traded on the main list.
"Hansapank moved higher and other stocks followed but selling pressure kept Uhispank and Tallinna Pank stable despite good volumes," one senior trader said.
"The market will come off slightly on Friday," he added.
Hansapank turned over 18 million kroons of shares to end 0.20 kroons higher at 268.20 kroons after recording highs of 273.22 during the day.
Total market capitalisation was stable at 13.97 billion kroons compared to Wednesday's 13.97 billion kroons.
Uhispank was the most active share on turnover of 18.7 million kroons, losing 1.08 kroons to finish at 56.25 kroons.
"The constant selling pressure holds (Uhispank's) price steady and there is still a good supply of stock available," he said.
Hoiupank saw a trade of 17.1 million of kroons to end 1.05 kroons higher at 130.00 kroons.
On the over-the-counter market, total trade was 6.9 million kroons of shares with diversified industrialist Norma as the most active stock.
Norma turned over 1.9 million kroons of shares. It closed 0.07 kroons higher at 74.90 kroons.
